items.sentence: I would just like to thank all of you for your work.
Everything was perfect, down to the smallest detail.
Just so we're clear, which one are we talking about?
Since Tom and I were in a hurry, we started running.
Do you think that anyone would care if Tom did that?
What makes you think that Tom would want to do that?
How do you think that you'd look wearing that dress?
I think that it's unlikely that Tom would ever move.
I think that it's unlikely that Tom will marry Mary.
The explosion could be heard from thirty miles away.
Do you happen to know where Tom went to high school?
How do you drink your coffee, with or without sugar?
Tom did a lot of things that he shouldn't have done.
Not everything that Tom told me about Mary was true.
It would be a good idea to get rid of all this junk.
He bargained with the house agent for a lower price.
I hope that Tom isn't really planning on doing that.
Please tell Tom he should do that as soon as he can.
If you can't understand this, you must be a bit dim.
You can't accomplish anything without taking a risk.
